info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 24 at 1:50AM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Perry, northern Union, northwestern Johnson, Williamson, Jackson and southwestern Franklin Counties through 230 AM CDT... At 150 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ava to 6 miles southwest of Murphysboro to near Grand Tower. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Murphysboro around 155 AM CDT. Carbondale, Cobden and Elkville around 200 AM CDT. De Soto and Cedar Lake Area around 205 AM CDT. Carterville, Christopher, Zeigler, Crainville, Cambria, Royalton and Hurst around 210 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Herrin, Energy, Valier, Marion, West Frankfort, Benton, Johnston City, Goreville, West City, Lake Of Egypt Area and Pittsburg. This includes the following highways... Interstate 24 in Illinois between Mile Markers 1 and 7. Interstate 57 in Illinois between Mile Markers 37 and 73. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
